abstract: Exxon Mobil said it would build a second chemicals factory in Singapore to meet rising demand in Asia.
snippet: Exxon Mobil said it would build a second chemicals factory in Singapore to meet rising demand in Asia.
lead_paragraph: Exxon Mobil said it would build a second chemicals factory in Singapore to meet rising demand in Asia. The plant will cost “several billion dollars” and will start up in 2011, Eva Ho, a spokeswoman based in Singapore, said. At the heart of the new plant is a cracker, which processes naphtha, an oil product, into ethylene, a raw material for making plastics. The installation is also expected to produce polyethylene and polypropylene.
